page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT PETROCKSTOWE cont
page.content: of employment is represented by teachers at three educational establishments outside the survey area: Clinton School Merton, Shebbear College and Marland School. Figures quoted relating to employment are based on one only adult earner per household, but a considerable amount of additional work, often part-time, is provided by those schools. Although primarily a{farming area, employment on the farms is very low - they are generally family-run - and employment covers a wide spectrum of occupations: civil engineer, solicitor estate agent, glass blower, haulier, carpenter, electrician, shipwright, etc.. Employment is dependent on motor vehicles as there are no trains and few buses. Everyone goes to work by car or motorcycle, travelling 3-20 miles each way daily.
